description:
An AMI image without ramdisk (ARI) cannot be started through the OpenStack API. It workswith EC2 API.
If an AMI image doesn't have 'ramdisk_id' property, the method '_do_get_kernel_ramdisk_from_image' of class 'CreateInstanceHelper' in file 'api/openstack/create_instance_helper.py' raise 'RamdiskNotFoundForImage' exception.

Proposed patch attachs to the bug. With this patch, the exception 'RamdiskNotFoundForImage' is no longer useful.
title: AMI image without ramdisk cannot be started through OS API

comments.content:
An AMI image without ramdisk (ARI) cannot be started through the OpenStack API. It workswith EC2 API.
If an AMI image doesn't have 'ramdisk_id' property, the method '_do_get_kernel_ramdisk_from_image' of class 'CreateInstanceHelper' in file 'api/openstack/create_instance_helper.py' raise 'RamdiskNotFoundForImage' exception.

Proposed patch attachs to the bug. With this patch, the exception 'RamdiskNotFoundForImage' is no longer useful.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ethuleau

comments.content:
In fact, the OSAPI need the property 'ramdisk_api' to start an AMI image even it's equal to none.
To put this property to None, just set 'ramdisk=""' in the glance add/upload command.
With EC2 API, if the property 'ramdisk_id' isn't set on the AMI image, Nova can instantiate it.
The path I proposed resolve that.
